overview_of_class: Ballet I is designed to learn a basic Classical Ballet Technique. Students will learn how to properly execute each step, how to connect them together, and the correct vocabulary of each step. The class has a big emphasis on proper alignment and understanding of the body to be able to build strength and flexibility in order to prevent injuries. Class consists of a warm up with a series of exercises at the Barre, follow by center work including Adagio, Pirouettes, Waltz, and finishes with a series of jumps combinations. This Class does not require previous Ballet training therefore students do not need the instructor permission.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To learn a series of basic Ballet Technique, its principals, vocabulary and proper execution of each step. To have a better understanding of proper alignment of the body. To build strength and flexibility both mental and physical.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
All students are required to have ballet slippers
Women: tights and leotard, hair Hair pulled back and out of the face
Men: tights, dance belt and a fitted t-shirt

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Suggested reading: technical manual and dictionary of Classical Ballet by Gail Grant
The Ballet Companion by Eliza Gaynor Minden
Anatomy of movement By Blandine Calais-Germain

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: No previous Ballet experience is required.
